Hi those who collaborate with some issues can assist too? If don't have anything in my calendar for those days I would like going there, for spending the nights I won't have much problem as I have family in Terrassa
3 messages were moved here from #community > #Dataverse2025 by Philip Durbin ðŸš€.
Thanks for the announcement, @Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s! Do you already know the address of the venue where the meeting will be?

Hi @Philipp Conzett!
We have not an address yet.

Hi everyone,

Weâ€™re happy to share that the Dataverse Community Meeting 2026 will be held in Barcelona, 26â€“29 May 2026, hosted by BSC-CNS and Harvard University. :tada:

Weâ€™re now looking for sponsors and partners interested in supporting this key event for the global Dataverse and open science communities.

If your organisation might be interested, please reach out to us at dcm2026@bsc.es. Weâ€™ll be sharing a detailed sponsorship proposal soon.

:raised_hands: Thanks for spreading the word!

The DCM2026 Organising Committee

Hello, long time no see friends. We have a quick question regarding custom metadata blocks. These can be enabled for datasets, can they also be enabled for collections (sub dataverse metadata)? Our use case is we want to mark which collections/sub dataverses can have their metadata exported and shown as collections in other online repositories. Thank you, AsbjÃ¸rn

My last exam on university it's on 23 May, if it's in 12-15 f i would not be able to assist, so will have to wait to further editions

Rachel Fernandez said:

Has there been a date change?

Oh! I didn't even notice! Apparently, yes!

oh no, if the event has been moved by two weeks to earlier, i might not be able to attend anymore :sweat_smile: is there any way to sign up for important announcements already, or is this thread the best place? i tend to book travel quite in advance, so would be good to keep up with any changes :sunglasses:
is 12-15 May the confirmed final dates? :thinking:

Hi there!
Yes, there was a change.
12-15 May is the confirmed date.

Dear Dataverse Community,
Weâ€™re excited to share some updates about the Dataverse Community Meeting 2026 (DCM2026)!
The event will now take place on 12â€“15 May 2026 at the Barcelona World Trade Center, right by the sea in the heart of Barcelona.
We look forward to seeing you there!

Best regards,
The DCM2026 Organising Committee
The call for papers is open! https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/
I announced it in the Jupyter Zulip.
awesome! it'd be great to have an idea when the call for submissions closes!
When you click through it says, "TheÂ deadline for abstract submission is 29Â January 2026, at 23:59 CET."
ah, thank you! didn't think to click through :joy:
There's a list of key dates at https://dcm2026.com/general-information/

Hi Dataverse Community!,

Just a friendly reminder after the holiday break that the Call for Papers for the Dataverse Community Meeting 2026 (Barcelona) is open.

ðŸ—“ Submission deadline: 29 January 2026
:link: Call for Papers: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/
:link: Conference themes: https://dcm2026.com/conference-themes/

We hope this reminder is helpful for those who may have missed the original announcement during the end-of-year period.

We look forward to your submissions and to welcoming you in Barcelona.

Best,
The DCM2026 Organising Committee
Heya @Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s. Just a heads up that I reposted this call to the Code 4 Lib mailing list.

Great!
Thanks @Julian Gautier !!
@Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s will working groups have a chance to meet?
@Sonia Barbosa is on the organizing committee and said she'd report back on in-person meetings for working groups.

Hi @Philip Durbin ðŸš€

To keep things consistent with the 2025 format at UNC, we have indeed reserved Tuesday, May 12th specifically for Satellite Meetings.

Weâ€™re excited to host these at the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC) installations! The main conference will then take place at the World Trade Center (WTC) from May 13thâ€“15th.

You can see the location details here: https://dcm2026.com/general-information/. Weâ€™ll be sharing more specifics soon on how groups can coordinate their space at the BSC!

And speaking about the schedule...

:siren: ONLY 2 DAYS LEFT TO SUBMIT! :siren:

If you want to present a talk or poster during the main sessions at the World Trade Center, the deadline is fast approaching:

  • Deadline: 29 January 2026, 23:59 CET

  • Theme: AI, Interoperability, and Sensitive Data

  • Submit here: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/

@Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s so I talked to the three working groups I'm part of (Documentation, pyDataverse, and Containerization) and we'd each love to take you up on your offer of having a 1-hour working group meeting on Tuesday, May 12th at BSC. Since some of us (like me) are part of multiple working groups, it would be ideal if the groups don't meet at the same time.

@Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s @Sonia Barbosa is there a reason why I can't submit my last two proposals and only save them as drafts?
image.png

@Oliver Bertuch I suppose it is for this reason:

  • Each Presenting author can submit a maximum of three (3) abstracts.
    https://barcelo.eventsair.com/PresentationPortal/dcm2026/abstractsportal/Presentation
Drat! I didn't see that!
Thanks @Juan !
In filling out proposals.... is Affiliation meant to be the university I work for, and then Organization for the department I work in? Or do I have that reversed? Thanks!
I don't know who can update it, but I just noticed DCM26 isn't on the events overview page of the dataverse.org website: https://dataverse.org/events

Hi everyone!

Weâ€™ve heard from several community members who need just a bit more time to polish their proposals. To make sure everyone has a chance to share their work, we are extending the deadline!

:spiral_calendar: New Deadline: Monday, February 2, 2026, at 23:59 CET

Whether you are focusing on AI, Interoperability, or Sensitive Data, you now have the weekend to finalize your abstracts for the main conference in Barcelona.

:point_right: Submit here: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/

We canâ€™t wait to see your submissions! :rocket::bar_chart:

Dieuwertje Bloemen said:

I don't know who can update it, but I just noticed DCM26 isn't on the events overview page of the dataverse.org website: https://dataverse.org/events

Good point! Fixed!

Hi everyone!

Weâ€™ve heard from several community members who need just a bit more time to polish their proposals. To make sure everyone has a chance to share their work, we are extending the deadline!

:spiral_calendar: New Deadline: Monday, February 2, 2026, at 23:59 CET

Whether you are focusing on AI, Interoperability, or Sensitive Data, you now have the weekend to finalize your abstracts for the main conference in Barcelona.

:point_right: Submit here: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/

We canâ€™t wait to see your submissions! :rocket::bar_chart:

Good to know. Slight extension but quite useful.

Hi everyone!

Weâ€™ve heard your requests for more time, so we are extending the submission window with two separate deadlines:

  • :speaking_head: Talks: Monday, February 2 (23:59 Pacific Time)

  • :picture: Posters: Monday, February 16 (23:59 Pacific Time)

Showcase your work! :bar_chart: For the posters, we especially encourage the community to show off their datasets, collections, or specific Dataverse installations. Itâ€™s a great way to share how you are using the platform in the real world.

:point_right: Submit your abstracts here: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/

Take advantage of the extra time to polish those proposals. We can't wait to see what you're working on! :rocket:
I already have too many proposals, but I really like the idea for installation posters!

Hi Community!
We have some exciting updates:

  1. Talks Update: The call for talks was a massive success! We received over 100 abstractsâ€”thank you for such an incredible response. :confetti:

  2. Posters (Deadline Feb 16!): You still have time to join the program! We want to see your Dataverses, Collections, and real-world success stories. Don't miss this chance to showcase your work. :point_right: Submit here: https://dcm2026.com/call-for-papers/

  3. Registration: Early Bird rates are available until February 28. Secure your spot at the best price! :point_right: Register here: https://dcm2026.com/registration/

See you in Barcelona! :flag_spain:
@Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s will it be possible for my company to pay the registration fee via bank transfer?

Hi @BalÃ¡zs Pataki !!
Yes, no problem!
If you would like to pay by bank transfer, please contact us at: dcm2026@bcocongresos.com.

Hi @Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s After a working group leader has submitted their registration for the conference and included a list of people who will attend their working group's meeting on May 12, will other people who aren't on that list but who have registered for the conference be able to attend that working group meeting?
Let me ask MarÃ­a Ferrer and I will come back to you @Julian Gautier

@Julian Gautier Here's the answer:
According to BSC rules, the main contact must provide the full names and email addresses of all attendees by April 30th. Only guests on the official meeting guest list will be admitted.

Therefore, it's best to have the guest list with a few extra names to process your access cards, rather than trying to process your access at the last minute.
Ah that's clear. Thanks! I'll let the working group leads know.
Hmm, it sounds like working group leads should start gathering a list of attendees pretty soon, if the list must be submitted at registration, which is already open.
@Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s thanks for the info!
Oh, I imagined that if leads wanted to add more names before April 30 but after they already registered, they could just email you Felipe or a colleague. Right?
Yes @Julian Gautier, we can append new attendees to the list in new mails before April 30th.

Hi @Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s Would you happen to know already at what time the programme will end on Friday? (We are looking at the flight schedules, and wonder if we would miss a lot taking an earlier flight back.)
Hi @Laura Huis in 't Veld, we don't have Friday's schedule yet. We will share the program once it is defined.

Hi everyone!

Two big reasons to head over to the Registration Page this week:

  1. Early Bird Ending: You have until February 28th to secure the reduced rate. Don't leave it for the last minute!

  2. May 12th is Filling Up: Our Satellite Meetings (at the BSC) are taking shape! We have already confirmed sessions for:

    • Workshops: Kubernetes (K8s) and others.

    • Working Groups: Containerization, PyDataverse, and Documentation.

    • GDCC Meetings: The Steering Committee Meeting.

  3. Program Reveal: We are putting the final touches on the schedule and expect to release the official program later this week! :calendar:

Want to host your own? The registration form is the primary mechanism to propose a new satellite meeting or joint brainstorm session. If you want to gather a group on May 12th, let us know through the form so we can coordinate the space!

See you in Barcelona! :rocket:

Hola @Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s! I am planning on registering soon, but wanted to know if the registration will include any meals? I need to include this information in my institutional travel request. Thanks!

Felipe GÃ³mez-CortÃ©s said:

  1. May 12th is Filling Up: Our Satellite Meetings (at the BSC) are taking shape! We have already confirmed sessions for:

    • Workshops: Kubernetes (K8s) and others.

If you are interested in this years edition of the Kubernetes workshop (no plain Docker session this time, so we have more time for big stuff!), let us know in #containers > K8s Workshop DCM26

Last year the room was packed, so please don't destroy our (my) illusions about people being eager to learn about modern tech stacks!
@Oliver Bertuch Thanks for the heads-up! We have people at DataverseNO who are interested. Please allows us a couple of days to figure out how many we'll be. Thanks!
@Oliver Bertuch Could you share this information also in the Dataverse Communinty Google group? I think there is broad interest in this!
Orly? Sure, can do.
@Oliver Bertuch your post looks great! Thanks for spreading the word!

Hi @Rachel Fernandez!
The registration includes breakfast and lunch for the main conference.

I can answer now!

Hi everyone!

We have some very important updates regarding DCM 2026 in Barcelona:

1). Early Bird Extended!
Good news! We have extended the Early Bird registration deadline. You now have until March 9th (23:59 CET) to secure the discounted rate.
:point_right:Â Register here:Â https://dcm2026.com/registration/

2). Preliminary Program is LIVE!
The moment youâ€™ve been waiting for! The preliminary program is now available on our website. Check out the incredible lineup of talks, keynotes, and sessions.
:point_right:Â View the Preliminary Program:Â https://dcm2026.com/preliminary-programme/

3). Action Required: Confirm Your Participation!Â âš 
The committee has sent out the final resolutions for Posters.

  • If you received an acceptance email: Please check your inbox and confirm your attendanceÂ immediately.
  • We still have many pending confirmations, and we need yours to finalize the official schedule!
  • If you were accepted for a Poster, please keep an eye out for the notification and reply as soon as possible.

We can't wait to see the community come together in Barcelona!Â :rocket:
